RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 111. Claiming Purse 40000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since February 1, 2014 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Races where entered for $16,000 or less not considered).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BACK FORTY took up the chase on the embattled pair from the two path on the turn, picked up interest when asked to as the half was being completed, got called upon entering the stretch, closed in readily on the front runners during the next eighth, altered course to the rail in midstretch, drove its way to the front with a sixteenth to go and kicked away. VOLASTIC off a beat slower than any other, departed the backstretch from the three path, swung one wider into the stretch, rallied belatedly to secure second. UPWARD got hooked in a duel with ATTRACTIVE RIDE right after the start, sparred with that opponent travelling three wide on the turn, had the fight spill over into the stretch, was still engaged with the aforementioned rival when the winner went by near the sixteenth marker, weakened into the show slot. ATTRACTIVE RIDE vied for command from the two path, drifted into the third one during the opening stages of the stretch drive, continued to argue for control before backing away in the final sixteenth. BOBBY V. quickly tucked along the inside route, cut the corner getting asked for run, faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Back Forty
ENTRY.OWNER: Drawing Away Stable and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased duel 2p,alter to rail 1/8,drove by pair 1/8,kicked away

ENTRY.NAME: Attractive Ride
ENTRY.OWNER: Falcone Robert All Heart Racing Stables and Falcone Jr Robert N
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 2p, drifted 3p upper, tired final 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Upward
ENTRY.OWNER: Schwartz, Barry K. and Dahlman, Ernest
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 3p, outfinished final 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Bobby V.
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick tuck inside, urged cutting corner, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Volastic
ENTRY.COMMENT: off beat slowest, 3w 1/2,4w upper, belatedly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 85. Maiden Claiming Purse 29000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRUEVES STAR took the overland route around the bend, closed the gap readily nearing the quarter pole, no doubt aided by the tempo having slowed down significantly, was set down, bidding well off the rail heading into the stretch, poked a head in front by the conclusion of the next furlong, vied with vigor against his stable mate, dug in with determination to stave that one off. DISTANT THOUGHTS chased the ongoing pace dispute from the two path on the turn, took off with a burst of speed from the five-sixteenths marker to lead the field into the stretch by a slim margin, got confronted by the winner in short order, relinquished reluctantly, fought well to re-claim the advantage, got denied. ROBERT NOBLE bobbled awkwardly towards the inside as the field was sent on its way, was in the two path and called for run by the midway point on the turn, fanned about four wide into the stretch, proved no match. FREIGHT three wide and urged on the turn, tired. DEIMOS rushed up into a forward position after the start, vacated the inside route nearing the end of the backstretch, pressed the issue from the two path for upcoming quarter, remained a prominent factor before giving way in the final furlong. PERCY'S AMBITION argued for control while saving ground, arrived at the five-sixteenths pole having already been put to a drive, was taken in hand getting displaced a sixteenth later. NIKI AND DYLAN off the inside, was through after going a half. YES I'M TRUE along the rail and asked on the turn, faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Strueves Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: overland route on turn, close gap late,bid 1/4,slim lead,dug in

ENTRY.NAME: Distant Thoughts
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit of pace fight, fought well, denied

ENTRY.NAME: Deimos
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up,tip 2p end back,duel turn,prominent to 1/8,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Robert Noble
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled awkward st,2p & asked 3/8,fan 4p upper, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Percy's Ambition
ENTRY.COMMENT: argued inside, drive by 5/16,in hand being displaced 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Yes I'm True
ENTRY.OWNER: Missile Approved Racing and Dalchand, Loumas R.
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside & asked on turn, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Niki and Dylan
ENTRY.COMMENT: off inside, through after a half

ENTRY.NAME: Freight
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w & urged on turn, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 93. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. (UP TO $13,500 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. (Non-starters For A Claiming Price of $40,000 or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOUT tossed his head at the start and stumbled shortly after, recovered to chase the front while three to four wide from mid pack, took closer order into the turn to be stacked four wide in close range of the leader three furlongs from home, came under encouragement at the five-sixteenths, cornered five wide into upper stretch, rallied steadily gaining through the final eighth and just got up in the last jumps. ASLAN tracked the pace along the rail in close aim of the front, shifted to the two path as the leader took to the fence at the nine-sixteenths, raced between foes through the turn, swung three wide for home, rallied to issue a challenge heads apart for command a furlong from home, took over just outside the sixteenth marker, dug in under threat himself and was nailed in the last jumps and forced to settle for the place honors. POINT HOPE just off the pace three wide, came under encouragement at the five-sixteenths, continued three wide for home, offered up a mild kick through the stretch but was outfinished by the top pair. COSMO BLUE broke in at the start and was corrected, established the front in hand just off the inside initially until shifted to the rail at the nine-sixteenths, came under light coaxing at the five-sixteenths before being set down spinning just off the inside for home, dug in under threat holding ASLAN at bay until headed just outside the sixteenth marker and weakened in the very late stages. RARE EAGLE off the inside early on, chased two to three wide through the turn under urging from midway, angled four to five wide for home, offered up a mild bid to improve his position while unable to impact the top four. MARCH TOO away well under coaxing at the start, raced three wide in range while in hand, came under coaxing stacked three wide three furlongs from home, angled four wide into upper stretch, tired in the drive. THROWBACK lunged slightly at the start, chased along the inside ridden along from midway on the turn, cut the corner into upper stretch, made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Aslan
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins in close aim, to 2p 9/16, 3w upper, up 1/16p, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Point Hope
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace 3w, asked 5/16, 3w upper, mild kick, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Throwback
ENTRY.COMMENT: slight lunge st, chased inside, urged 3/8, cut corner, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Tout
ENTRY.OWNER: Claiborne Farm and Dilschneider, Adele B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: tossed head, stumbled st, 3-4w pursuit, 5w 1/4p, rallied, just up

ENTRY.NAME: Cosmo Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in st, in hand 2p, to rail 9/16, dug in, headed 1/16, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: March Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well coaxed, 3w in range, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Rare Eagle
ENTRY.COMMENT: off inside early, chased 2-3w turn, 4-5w 1/4p, mild bid, improved

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 1M Turf CR: 79. Claiming Purse 34000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over since February 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races where entered for $20,000 o r less not considered) (Winners Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the main track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THUNDERING GALE tucked along the inside after the start, was pulling with some force on the bit during the initial stages, slipped off the inside route past the half mile pole, advanced steadily into contention, swung into the stretch as the widest of three front runners, was almost at the three-sixteenths pole before asked for a response, gave it, emerging at the eighth pole as the new leader, drew off, kept to some urging until nearly the end. FLIRTATIOUS SPRING strung out three wide on the chute, took up the chase closer to the rail thereafter, spun four to five wide into the stretch, put to some encouragement while doing so, raced side by side with GREAT CROSS, came inward nearing the furlong marker after some right handed pressure, leading the pilot of the previously-mentioned opponent to steady, continued onward in a willing manner to garner the place, although never posing a danger to the top one. WILLIAM'SLUCKYGRAY assumed a forward position after the start, prompted LADY HALITE to that rival's outside, got carried out by that foe heading for the end of the backstretch, continued to prompt the pace, primarily two wide on the turn, made a successful bid to take over as three-quarters was being completed, was pounced upon by the eventual winner, yielded before all the way through the furlong grounds, got outfinished late for the place. EUROKAY BY ME had the rider take hold after bobbing at the start, settled along the inside route, cut the corner into the stretch, paused off another's heels before tipping outward in the three-sixteenths marker, mustered up a mild response. GREAT CROSS left the inside past the half mile pole, swung four wide into the stretch, was forced to steady at the eighth pole, after the runner up came over, failed to regain any real interest. OVER MY HEAD saved ground to the quarter pole, was briskly urging getting angled into the stretch, flattened out. DRAMATIZE three wide on the chute, took up the chase from the two path on the turn, tired. LEMON AND HONEY three wide midway on the turn, fanned into the six path traversing through the furlong grounds, had no offering. BEBES PASSION took up the chase being two wide on the turn, commenced the final furlong in the seven path, had no rally. LADY HALITE quickly gained the advantage, showed the way from off the inside, rider aboard with a snug grip on the left side, came out several paths proceeding down the backstretch, carrying out WILLIAM'SLUCKYGRAP momentarily, vied with that opponent on the turn, from a slight distance from off the rail, was put to the test by a pair heading home and succumbed.

ENTRY.NAME: Over My Head
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground to 1/4,urged angling into lane, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Great Cross
ENTRY.COMMENT: left rail 7/16,4w into lane,forced to steady 1/8pl

ENTRY.NAME: Bebes Passion
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p on turn, placed 7w 1/8,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Halite
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p back (snug left),came out brief back,near ins turn,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Eurokay by Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobble st,cut corner, pause off heels 3/16,mildly

ENTRY.NAME: William'sluckygray
ENTRY.COMMENT: off ins,brief carried out back,press 2p turn,bid 1/4,led,yield

ENTRY.NAME: Thundering Gale
ENTRY.COMMENT: tuck ins,pull bit early,slip 2p 7/16,bid 3w 1/4,ask uppr,drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Flirtatious Spring
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w chute,2p turn,fan 4w upper, left ins,came in 1/8,willingly 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Lemon and Honey
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w 3/8,fanned 6p furlong grounds, had no offering

ENTRY.NAME: Dramatize
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w chute, chased 2p turn, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 99. Claiming Purse 32000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of two races since February 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A race since then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Races where entered for $16,000 or less not considered).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GLICKMAN broke on top and maintained the advantage, was kept entrenched in the two path, tugging on the left side of the bit right from the get go, entered the stretch, drifted out one path wider racing down the lane, head still cocked to the left throughout the stretch drive. SIR BOND took up the chase mostly from the two path on the turn, swung four wide into the stretch, proved no match, while the others clearly proved no match to him with regards to place honors. INDY SEA bobbled at the start, tucked along the rail, rode it to the quarter pole, angled outward for the stretch, lacked the needed response. AWESOME HEART briefly placed along the rail, departed the backstretch from the three path, swung into fifth one after turning for home, made no headway. STREET SWAGG underwent a four wide pursuit on the turn, gave way. YOU YOU got bumped at the start, took up the chase from the two path, failed to menace. HERE COMES SAL bumped with YOU YOU at the start, stalked the winner from the three path and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Glickman
ENTRY.OWNER: Drawing Away Stable and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: took lead,pace 2p,tug left side throughout,stayed clear

ENTRY.NAME: Awesome Heart
ENTRY.COMMENT: briefly rail back,3w 3/8, 5w 3/16, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Indy Sea
ENTRY.OWNER: Dubb, Michael, Bethlehem Stables LLC and Aisquith, Gary
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start,tuck ins,angle out 1/4,lack needed response

ENTRY.NAME: You You
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start,chased 2p, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Here Comes Sal
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, stalked 3w, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Street Swagg
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit on turn, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Bond
ENTRY.COMMENT: off inside, 4w into lane, no match, willingly for place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 1 3/8M Inner turf CR: 95. Allowance Purse 77000. (UP TO $13,860 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $10,000 ONCE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming, Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Since February 1, 2014 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Other Than Claiming, Or Starter At Any Distance Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. (Non-starters For A Claiming Price of $25,000 o Less In The Last 3 Starts Pref erred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile and One Eighth on the main track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CLOTURE bumped lightly at the start by ABBEY STREET, rated just off the pace just off the inside behind cover, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun three wide for home, angled in a path a furlong out, rallied to seize command at the sixteenth pole and inched away late on to prevail. ABBEY STREET broke in a step bumping lightly with CLOTURE, tracked the pace in reserve just off the inside in closest aim, came under coaxing three furlongs out, took over at the head of the stretch roused, dug in under challenge from a trio inside the furlong grounds through to the sixteenth marker when headed for command, fought on to the finish to garner the place. SILKY (IRE) broke out at the start and was corrected, rated three wide in the clear in range of the leader, came under encouragement midway on the far turn, cornered three to four wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick to threaten through to the wire but was out kicked and forced to settle for the show honors. MORETHANAWARNING saved ground under rating at the rear, came under a ride three furlongs from home, angled four wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick for the last major share. DANCE CRAZE tracked the pace in reserve along the fence behind the cover of the leader, got roused spinning just off the inside for home, weakened in the stretch. GLORIOUS CHANT away well, established the front under a firm hold along the inside, remained on hold until the five-sixteenths when given some rein to work with, cut the corner displaced on the front put to a drive and faltered in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Dance Craze
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside in reserve, roused 1/4p, weakened stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Glorious Chant
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, firm hold ins, yielded cutting corner, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Cloture
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated just off pace 2p, urged 5/16, 3w 1/4p, up 1/16, inched away

ENTRY.NAME: Abbey Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p in reserve, coaxed 3/8, up 1/4, headed 1/16, fought on

ENTRY.NAME: Morethanawarning
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved grd at rear, urged 3/8, angled 4w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Silky (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out st, rated 3w in clear, urged 3/8, 3-4w upper, mild kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 6F Inner turf CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. INNER TURF (UP TO $13,500 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs. (Non-starters For A Claiming Price of $40,000 or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MY CARA MIA away without apparent mishap, was unhurried while racing two wide for nearly a half, fanned into the six path travelling through the furlong grounds, kicked into her best stride after completing the maneuver, surged by the runner up in the deep stretch to prove best. OVERSPENDING pressed the issue from the two path during the run around the bend, closed in to tackle the leader as the half was being completed, forged to the front during the next furlong being chased by a horde of horses, dug in with good determination but couldn't match the winner's late foot. GREYWALLS sat forwardly towards the inside for the initial half, tipped into the two path for commencement of the stretch,. was yanked on the right side altering course further to the outside after closing in precariously on another, battled on stubbornly in the final furlong en route for the show. ALL IN FUN got off to a sluggish beginning, took up the chase two to three wide on the bend, got angled four wide into the stretch, came in slightly and briefly prior to the start of the final furlong, with the rider of CONSUMER CREDIT increasing his hold, held on well to secure the last major check. ZEEZEE ZOOMZOOM appeared rank oh the bit nestled amongst rivals nearing the end of the backstretch, sat within range of the front runners in the two path on the turn, had the rider take hold for a jump seeming to be in a bit tight in the vicinity of the five-sixteenths marker, entered the stretch and was given her cue, rallied tenaciously to loom a bold threat by the end of the furlong grounds, couldn't sustain the move and flattened. LANA'S FORTUNE three wide at the five-sixteenths pole, was in the five path a furlong later, mustered up a mild stretch response. CONSUMER CREDIT tracked the front runners towards the inside, was forced to be kept on the hold for most of the way from the five-sixteenths pole to the top of the lane, caught behind rivals, eased off the rail, got caught in another traffic jam starting about a sixteenth down the road, had the pilot take hold momentarily responding to being in close proximity to ALL IN FUN in midstretch, gained some but not optimal racing clearance late, crossed the finish line not having been given her cue. SHIMMERING CARA vied for command from the two path for a good portion of the way down the backstretch, undertook the task from the rail on the turn, came under intensified pressure heading for the quarter pole and got called upon for run, yielded and steadily backed away. WALL STREET LADY three wide, chased the pace for a half and tired. MISBEHAVIN MISS ducked in after hesitating at the start, saved ground to no avail while trailing throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Consumer Credit
ENTRY.OWNER: Klaravich Stables, Inc. and Lawrence, William H.
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins,stuck in traffic 1/4,stuck in traffic from upper,never asked

ENTRY.NAME: Misbehavin Miss
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated,ducked in start, saved ground no avail, trailed

ENTRY.NAME: Greywalls
ENTRY.COMMENT: forward ins to 1/4,alter off foe 3/16,gamely

ENTRY.NAME: All in Fun
ENTRY.COMMENT: sluggish st,2-3w urge on turn,4w into lane,in step 1/8,held well

ENTRY.NAME: Zeezee Zoomzoom
ENTRY.COMMENT: nestled & rank early,brief tight 5/16,flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Shimmering Cara
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside turn, tested 1/4,yielded furlong grounds, backed away

ENTRY.NAME: My Cara Mia
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried 2p,fan 6p 3/16,kicked into stride,rolled by late

ENTRY.NAME: Wall Street Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, chased pair on turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Lana's Fortune
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w 5/16, 6w 3/16, mildly

ENTRY.NAME: Overspending
ENTRY.COMMENT: press pace 2p,slim lead hounded by horde 1/8,dug in,yield late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Left Bank S. BELMONT PARK RACE 8 1M Dirt CR: 121. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A GRADED SWEEPSTAKES IN 2014. By subscription of $100 each which should accompany the nomination; $500 to pass the entry box and an additional $500 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a suppleme ntal nomination payment of $1,000 along with the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 60% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth, 3% to fifth and 2% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights, three year olds, 120 lbs. Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstake in 2014 allowed 2 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claiming or starter in 2014, 4 lbs.; of one such race in 2014, 6 lbs. A presen tation will be made to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, August 23, 2014 with 32 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLDEN TICKET raced from off the inside throughout, sat detached from the others during the opening stages, picked up the pace after leaving the half mile pole, got angled outward into the five path past from the five-sixteenths pole, closed in readily after getting straightened away, grabbed away the lead with a few strides to spare before arriving at the finish line. PANTS ON FIRE leaned briefly on INTEGRITY at the start, patiently stalked that rival to the quarter pole, challenged for command after arriving at that station, held on willingly to the end en route to garnering the place. INTEGRITY rubbed shoulders with PANTS ON FIRE as the field was sent off and running, gained control, showed the way being rated along the inside, got put to a stern test approaching the quarter pole, yielded reluctantly in the final stages. STORMIN MONARCHO bobbled at the start, underwent a three wide pursuit on the turn, commenced the stretch one path wider, lacked the needed late closing punch. ALPHA fought the bit during the initial stages, was angled off the inside route in upper stretch, had no response.

ENTRY.NAME: Alpha
ENTRY.COMMENT: fought bit early,saved ground to upper, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Ticket
ENTRY.COMMENT: detached early,2p,5w angle from 5/16,up near wire

ENTRY.NAME: Stormin Monarcho
ENTRY.OWNER: Roman, Lawrence P. and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, 3w pursuit on turn, 4w upper,outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Pants On Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: leaned on brk,stalked 2p,bid 1/4,willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Integrity
ENTRY.COMMENT: rub shoulders break,rated inside,stern test 1/4,held well show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 9 1 1/16M Turf CR: 78. Maiden Claiming Purse 41000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Non-starters For A Claiming Price of $16,000 or Less In The L ast Start Preferred). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLUE CHIPS ONLY bumped at the start by BASKETS who broke inwards, established the front out of the dog legged chute into the backside crossing to the rail while in hand, remained on hold until nearing the quarter pole, cut the corner roused for home, remained safely in front to the eighth pole, came under threat inside the final sixteenth, dug in holding well and repelled his main threat to the wire. BOB AND JIM coaxed at the start, settled just off the inside in mid pack, came under encouragement swinging three wide into upper stretch, rallied readily to challenge a sixteenth from home, dug in steadily eating away at the leader's advantage but was repelled to the wire. BASKETS broke in at the start bumping BLUE CHIPS ONLY, tracked the pace just off the inside in close aim, got put to urging at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside for home, kept on through the stretch for the show honors. EAST BAY LODGE just off the inside at the rear, came under urging three furlongs out, angled three wide into upper stretch, kicked on mildly and belatedly for the last major share. DOC DANEKA two to three wide towards the rear, came under prolonged coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, took closer order on the front and swung four wide into upper stretch, rallied into striking range a furlong out then made no late headway in the final sixteenth. WHYALWAYSME tracked the pace along the inside in range of the front and behind the cover of the leader, cut the corner into behind that foe let out into upper stretch, angled to the two path at the three-sixteenths, weakened in the late stages. PATROLIKEACHAMPION three wide in pursuit from mid pack, came under a ride at the five-sixteenths, continued three wide for home, weakened in the stretch. JACOB'S HERE hustled from the gate, saved ground towards the rear, commenced prolonged encouragement from the half mile pole, angled four wide into upper stretch, made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Doc Daneka
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w towards rear, urged 7/16, 4w upper, no late headway

ENTRY.NAME: Jacob's Here
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, saved grd towards rear, urged 1/2p, 4w 1/4, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Bob and Jim
ENTRY.OWNER: Kaufman, Robert, Iselin, James H. and Schechter, Jeffrey H.
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 2p mid pack, urged 3w upper, rallied, repelled

ENTRY.NAME: Patrolikeachampion
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w mid pack, asked 5/16, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Whyalwaysme
ENTRY.OWNER: I Claim I Saw I Conquered
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside in range, cut corner let out, to 2p 3/16, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: East Bay Lodge
ENTRY.COMMENT: at rear 2p, urged 3/8, 3w upper, mild belated kick

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Chips Only
ENTRY.OWNER: Peskoff, Jeremy and Hidden Lake Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, in hand 2p, cut corner roused, dug in, held well

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Hidden Lake Farm, LLC & Jeremy Peskoff

ENTRY.NAME: Baskets
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in st, 2p in close aim, asked 5/16, kept on
